questions.question: What is the chemical structure of H4L?
What is the maximum CO2 storage capacity of NOTT-202a at 195 K and 1.0 bar?
What unique structural feature does NOTT-202 exhibit?
questions.answer: Partial double interpenetration with one fully present net (A) and one secondary net (B) with occupancy 0.75

questions.question: Why does NOTT-202a exhibit selective hysteretic CO2 adsorption/desorption?
questions.answer: Due to its unique partially interpenetrated structure and the temperature-dependent behavior below the triple point of CO2

questions.question: What method was used to simulate the stepwise adsorption in NOTT-202a?
At what temperature range does NOTT-202a show adsorption/desorption hysteresis for CO2?
questions.answer: Between 195 and 213 K, below the triple point of CO2

questions.question: What is the selectivity ratio of CO2 over CH4 at 195 K during adsorption in NOTT-202a?
True or False: The BET surface area of NOTT-202a is the highest among In(iii)-based MOFs.
What role does the quadrupole moment of CO2 play in the adsorption process in NOTT-202a?
questions.answer: It contributes to the framework flexibility and induces phase transitions in the framework structure

questions.question: True or False: The adsorption isotherms for N2, Ar, and H2 in NOTT-202a at 195 K exhibit similar stepwise and hysteretic behavior as CO2.
What is the role of temperature in the selective hysteretic sorption of CO2 in NOTT-202a?
questions.answer: Temperature controls the selectivity and hysteretic behavior of CO2 sorption by affecting the state of CO2 and the flexibility of the framework.

questions.question: What is the significance of the observed partial interpenetration in NOTT-202?
questions.answer: It represents a new class of porous material with enhanced adsorption properties due to structural vacancies and defects.

questions.question: True or False: The desolvated material NOTT-202a undergoes a significant structural phase transition from NOTT-202.
How does NOTT-202a compare to other MOF/ZIF materials in terms of CO2 selectivity at 195 K?
questions.answer: NOTT-202a exhibits higher selectivity for CO2 over other gases compared to other MOF/ZIF materials at 195 K.

questions.question: What experimental technique was used to confirm the microscopic CO2-host ordering in NOTT-202a?
True or False: The CO2 adsorption/desorption hysteresis in NOTT-202a is observed at all temperatures.
What is the role of the triple point of CO2 in the adsorption behavior of NOTT-202a?
questions.answer: The triple point of CO2 distinguishes the temperature ranges where hysteretic or reversible CO2 adsorption behavior is observed.

questions.question: True or False: The presence of quadrupole moment of CO2 and MOF geometry are crucial for step formation during adsorption process into NOTT-202a.
What is the significance of the observed adsorption steps in the CO2 isotherm of NOTT-202a?
questions.answer: The adsorption steps correspond to sequential filling of different pores within the MOF, indicating a unique adsorption mechanism.

questions.question: True or False: The adsorption of Ar into NOTT-202a shows steps similar to CO2 under the same conditions.
